title: UK Man Enslaved For 26 Years In Filthy Caravan To Receive Rs 12 Crore
content: The Rooney family exploited homeless men for over two decades, resulting in 15 deaths. In 2017, 11 family members were imprisoned for 79 years.
summary: The Rooney family exploited homeless men for over two decades, resulting in 15 deaths. In 2017, 11 family members were imprisoned for 79 years.

title: Serena Williams Says Paris Restaurant Denied Entry, Staff Explains Incident
content: The restaurant said, "We do always try to make space for walk-in guests but sometimes this is not possible."
summary: The restaurant said, "We do always try to make space for walk-in guests but sometimes this is not possible."

title: Pak Man Arrested For Plot To Kill Trump, Had Planned Protests As Diversion
content: A Pakistani citizen has been charged in an elaborate plot that reads like a spy thriller to assassinate Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump.
summary: A Pakistani citizen has been charged in an elaborate plot that reads like a spy thriller to assassinate Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump.

title: Nobel Laureate To Lead Bangladesh's Army-Backed Interim Government
content: Bangladesh's Nobel-winning microfinance pioneer Muhammad Yunus has been named the head of the military-backed interim government after the ouster of Sheikh Hasina amid massive protests.
summary: Bangladesh's Nobel-winning microfinance pioneer Muhammad Yunus has been named the head of the military-backed interim government after the ouster of Sheikh Hasina amid massive protests.

title: Microsoft Blames Delta For Its Struggle To Recover From Global Outage
content: Microsoft blamed Delta Air Lines on Tuesday for its dayslong struggle to recover from a global cyber outage that led it to cancel more than 6,000 flights.
summary: Microsoft blamed Delta Air Lines on Tuesday for its dayslong struggle to recover from a global cyber outage that led it to cancel more than 6,000 flights.

title: Nobel Laureate Muhammad Yunus Named Chief Adviser Of Bangladesh Interim Government: Updates
content: Nobel Peace Prize laureate Muhammad Yunus was named chief adviser of Bangladesh's interim government on Tuesday, a day after Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina resigned and fled the country following a violent crackdown on a student-led uprising.
summary: Nobel Peace Prize laureate Muhammad Yunus was named chief adviser of Bangladesh's interim government on Tuesday, a day after Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina resigned and fled the country following a violent crackdown on a student-led uprising.

title: Poor Man's Banker To Leading Bangladesh: Muhammad Yunus's Journey
content: Bangladesh is pinning its hopes on one of the nation's most acclaimed intellectuals to bring stability to a country scarred by coups and political upheaval.
summary: Bangladesh is pinning its hopes on one of the nation's most acclaimed intellectuals to bring stability to a country scarred by coups and political upheaval.

title: Google Antitrust Ruling May Pose $20 Billion Risk For Apple: Report
content: Apple's lucrative deal with Google could be under threat after a U.S. judge ruled that the Alphabet-owned search giant was operating an illegal monopoly.
summary: Apple's lucrative deal with Google could be under threat after a U.S. judge ruled that the Alphabet-owned search giant was operating an illegal monopoly.

title: Israel Calls To "Swiftly Eliminate" New Hamas Chief
content: Israel's foreign minister called on Tuesday to "swiftly eliminate" Yahya Sinwar, who was appointed by Hamas as the group's new political leader replacing Ismail Haniyeh who was killed in Tehran last week.
summary: Israel's foreign minister called on Tuesday to "swiftly eliminate" Yahya Sinwar, who was appointed by Hamas as the group's new political leader replacing Ismail Haniyeh who was killed in Tehran last week.

title: "Now It Is War": Elon Musk's X Sues Advertisers Over Boycott
content: Elon Musk's X sued an advertising group and several large corporations on Tuesday accusing them of causing billions of dollars of losses by "illegally" boycotting the social media platform.
summary: Elon Musk's X sued an advertising group and several large corporations on Tuesday accusing them of causing billions of dollars of losses by "illegally" boycotting the social media platform.

title: Deeply Concerned About Reports Of Violence In Bangladesh: US
content: The United States has expressed deep concerns about the continued violence in Bangladesh including attacks on members of religious or political groups.
summary: The United States has expressed deep concerns about the continued violence in Bangladesh including attacks on members of religious or political groups.

title: Mob Sets Hindu Musician Rahul Ananda's House On Fire In Dhaka
content: The house of Hindu musician Rahul Ananda was looted and set on fire by an angry mob following the fall of Sheikh Hasina's government. The mob attacked the musician's residence, located in Dhaka's Dhanmondi 32, on Monday afternoon.
summary: The house of Hindu musician Rahul Ananda was looted and set on fire by an angry mob following the fall of Sheikh Hasina's government. The mob attacked the musician's residence, located in Dhaka's Dhanmondi 32, on Monday afternoon.

title: Pak Citizen Arrested In Alleged Iran Plot To Kill US Official, Politician
content: A Pakistani man with ties to Iran has been arrested for allegedly plotting to assassinate a US official in retaliation for the US killing of Revolutionary Guards commander Qassem Soleimani, the Justice Department said Tuesday.
summary: A Pakistani man with ties to Iran has been arrested for allegedly plotting to assassinate a US official in retaliation for the US killing of Revolutionary Guards commander Qassem Soleimani, the Justice Department said Tuesday.

title: Nobel Laureate Muhammad Yunus To Lead Bangladesh Interim Government
content: Bangladesh's Nobel-winning microfinance pioneer Muhammad Yunus has been tapped to lead an interim government after the ouster of prime minister Sheikh Hasina, the country's presidency announced early Wednesday.
summary: Bangladesh's Nobel-winning microfinance pioneer Muhammad Yunus has been tapped to lead an interim government after the ouster of prime minister Sheikh Hasina, the country's presidency announced early Wednesday.

title: Families Of People Killed In Bangladesh Protests Place 11-Point Demands
content: Families of the persons killed in Bangladesh's student protests on Tuesday placed 11-point demands, including rehabilitation by providing jobs, before the interim government,

title: Hamas Names New Chief After Ismail Haniyeh's Killing
content: Hamas named Gaza Strip chief Yahya Sinwar as its new political leader on Tuesday, a week after his predecessor Ismail Haniyeh's killing in Tehran which has sent regional tensions soaring.
summary: Hamas named Gaza Strip chief Yahya Sinwar as its new political leader on Tuesday, a week after his predecessor Ismail Haniyeh's killing in Tehran which has sent regional tensions soaring.

title: Chinese Academic Convicted Of Acting As Foreign Agent In US
content: Wang Shujun was a naturalised US citizen.

title: Israel Army Confirms Death Of Last Missing Person From October 7 Attack
content: The Israeli military confirmed on Tuesday that Bilha Yinon, the last person listed as missing from the October 7 Hamas attack, was killed by militants that day.
summary: The Israeli military confirmed on Tuesday that Bilha Yinon, the last person listed as missing from the October 7 Hamas attack, was killed by militants that day.

title: Discovery Of Tiny Arm Bone Sheds Light On Mysterious ''Hobbit'' Humans
content: The discovery of a tiny arm bone suggests that an ancient human dubbed "hobbits" only shrank down to their diminutive size after they arrived on an Indonesian island a million years ago, scientists said on Tuesday.
summary: The discovery of a tiny arm bone suggests that an ancient human dubbed "hobbits" only shrank down to their diminutive size after they arrived on an Indonesian island a million years ago, scientists said on Tuesday.
